title: JingPad A1 bootloader unlock tool, Android ROM, and source code are now available
content:
The JingPad A1 was launched back in August last year with the tagline: “Worldâ€™s First Consumer-Level Linux Tablet.” This device, complete with its gigantic 11-inch 4:3 AMOLED display, Unisoc Tiger T7510 SoC, an 8,000mAh battery with 18W wired charging support, and a premium design, brought tough competition to other Linux-powered ARM64 tablets like the Pine64

The post JingPad A1 bootloader unlock tool, Android ROM, and source code are now available appeared first on xda-developers.
description: The JingPad A1 can now be bootloader unlocked. Its maker has also released an Android ROM and published the sources for the tablet. Read on!
